column1: '''Gilrain''' was a long river that flowed south out of the [[White Mountains]] through western [[Lebennin]] in the south of [[Gondor]]. Its tributary was [[Serni]]
The Gilrain flowed swiftly from its source until at the end of the outlier of the mountains it ran into a wide shallow depression.  In this area it wandered for awhile
column2: forming a small mere before it cut through a ridge and fell in waterfalls
column3: from whence it again flowed swiftly towards the [[Bay of Belfalas]]

column1: Legend said that [[Nimrodel]] tarried there upon its banks as she came south out of the White Mountains
column2: falling into a long sleep and thus missing [[Amroth]]'s ship.<ref name=Amroth>{{UT|Amroth}}</ref>

column1: The first element in the [[Sindarin]] name ''Gilrain'' is ''[[gil]]'' ("spark")
column2: and the second element derives from the root [[RAN]] ("wander

column1: :The river Gilrain formed the border between the areas of [[Dor-en-Ernil]] and Lower [[Lebennin]] in the region of Central [[Gondor]]. The river was the domain of the gentle River-maid Roamingstar
column3: who dwelt in the mere. Roamingstar lulled the elf-maid [[Nimrodel]] to sleep with her song and so accidentally caused the Elf to lose her beloved
column5: a tragedy the River-maid still felt guilt for during the [[War of the Ring]]. She and her sisters were widely considered myths by then
column6: but when her aid was sought for Gondor she gave it by preventing the Ruthless Dead from crossing her river into Lebennin.
